name: Odysseus
title: Greek - Odysseus
role: King of Ithaca, Hero of the Trojan War, Central Figure of the Odyssey
summary: Odysseus, man of many ways (polytropos), is the cunning hero of Homer's Odyssey and a key figure in the Iliad. Known for his intelligence rather than brute strength, he devised the Trojan Horse that ended the war. His ten-year journey home to Ithaca - battling monsters, resisting temptations, and longing for wife and homeland - has made 'odyssey' synonymous with epic journey. His reunion with faithful Penelope and slaughter of the suitors culminates the greatest homecoming story ever told.
description: Odysseus, man of many ways, is the protagonist of Homer's Odyssey. Renowned for his cunning (metis) rather than strength, he devised the Trojan Horse and navigated ten years of adventures returning home. His encounters with Cyclops, Circe, Scylla, Sirens, and Calypso have become archetypal. His faithful return to Penelope embodies the Greek value of nostos (homecoming).
symbols: The bow (only he could string it)

iliad_role.description: Cunning counselor and warrior, key diplomat among the Greeks
key_moments: Deviser of the Trojan Horse (mentioned in Odyssey)

odyssey_role.description: Central protagonist whose journey home drives the entire narrative
structure: Books 1-4: Telemachy (Telemachus seeks news of his father)
Books 5-8: Odysseus with Calypso and Phaeacians
Books 9-12: Odysseus recounts his adventures (Cyclops, Circe, Sirens, etc.)
Books 13-24: Return to Ithaca and slaughter of suitors

key_epithets_from_homer: Man of many ways (polytropos) - first word describing him
famous_lines: Tell me, O Muse, of that man of many ways... (Opening of Odyssey)
Nobody is my name. Nobody they call me. (to Polyphemus)

adventures.cicones: First stop after Troy, where Odysseus lost men to counter-attack
adventures.lotus_eaters: Land where men forgot home after eating the lotus
adventures.cyclops: Blinded Polyphemus, Poseidon's son, using the name 'Nobody'
adventures.aeolus: Received bag of winds, but crew opened it near Ithaca
adventures.laestrygonians: Giant cannibals who destroyed all ships but Odysseus's
adventures.circe: Witch who turned men to pigs; became Odysseus's lover for a year
adventures.underworld: Descended to consult Tiresias; saw his mother and heroes
adventures.sirens: Tied himself to mast to hear their deadly song
adventures.scylla_charybdis: Chose to pass Scylla, losing six men rather than all
adventures.thrinacia: Crew ate sacred cattle of Helios; all died except Odysseus
adventures.calypso: Held seven years by the nymph who offered immortality
adventures.phaeacians: Received gifts and passage home after telling his story

quests: Fought at Troy for ten years
Devised the Trojan Horse to end the war
Journeyed ten years to return home to Ithaca
Slew the suitors of Penelope upon return
Reunited with faithful wife and grown son
feats: Devised the Trojan Horse that ended the war
Blinded the Cyclops Polyphemus and escaped
Resisted the Sirens' song while hearing it
Descended to the Underworld and returned
Strung the great bow and slew 108 suitors
companions: Elpenor (died on Aeaea, met in underworld)
The crew (all lost before reaching home)
weapons: The great bow (wedding gift, only he could string)

mother: met her shade in the underworld
wife: renowned for her fidelity and cleverness
son: who grew to manhood during Odysseus's absence
divine_patron: Athena - favored him above all mortals for his cunning
divine_enemy: Poseidon - cursed him for blinding Polyphemus

the_bow.description: The great bow of Odysseus, a wedding gift that only he could string
the_bow.significance: Penelope set the contest of the bow to choose among suitors
the_bow.climax: Odysseus strung the bow and shot through twelve axe-heads, then slew the suitors
